camel.sink.path.host.name: camel.sink.path.host
camel.sink.path.host.description: The Thrift server host name. This is localhost or 0.0.0.0 (if not defined) when being a consumer or remote server host name when using producer.

camel.sink.path.service.name: camel.sink.path.service
camel.sink.path.service.description: Fully qualified service name from the thrift descriptor file (package dot service definition name)

camel.sink.endpoint.compressionType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.compressionType
camel.sink.endpoint.compressionType.description: Protocol compression mechanism type One of: [NONE] [ZLIB]

camel.sink.endpoint.exchangeProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.exchangeProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.exchangeProtocol.description: Exchange protocol serialization type One of: [BINARY] [JSON] [SJSON] [COMPACT]

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.sslParameters.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sslParameters
camel.sink.endpoint.sslParameters.description: Configuration parameters for SSL/TLS security negotiation

camel.component.thrift.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.thrift.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.thrift.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.thrift.basicPropertyBind.name: camel.component.thrift.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.thrift.basicPropertyBind.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.thrift.useGlobalSslConte.name: camel.component.thrift.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.thrift.useGlobalSslConte.description: Determine if the thrift component is using global SSL context parameters
